255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"An operating system (OS) is system software that manages computer hardware and software resources and provides common services for computer programs.\",\"color\":\"#000000\",\"fontfamily\":\"NotoSans\",\"fontsize\":18,\"fontweight\":false,\"fontstyle\":false,\"align\":\"left\"}"}}]},{"x":0,"y":0,"w":100,"h":100,"id":"c82308eb-4c9b-4637-b525-a1a26c56646e","rotate":null,"config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 0)","strokeWidth":1,"opacity":1,"editable":false,"version":"V2","offsetY":0.04,"h":20.09,"rotate":0,"textType":"text","lineHeight":1,"z-index":0,"font":"NotoSans","fontsize":48,"weight":"","id":"e3aa55ec-61d5-4a4c-baa4-20328be799ea","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, of processor time, mass storage, printing, and other resources\",\"color\":\"#000000\",\"fontfamily\":\"NotoSans\",\"fontsize\":18,\"fontweight\":false,\"fontstyle\":false,\"align\":\"left\"}"}}]},{"x":0,"y":0,"w":100,"h":100,"id":"bd85bbc6-7922-47d1-a667-06016ac8b1d5","rotate":null,"config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"color\":\"#FFFFFF\",\"instructions\":\"\",\"genieControls\":false}"},"param":[{"name":"previous","value":"c82308eb-4c9b-4637-b525-a1a26c56646e"},{"name":"next","value":"0caacc74-072d-4e93-87d1-7b4516571796"}],"manifest":{"media":[]},"org.ekstep.text":[{"x":14.86,"y":20.74,"minWidth":20,"w":62.19,"maxWidth":500,"fill":"#000000","fontStyle":"normal","fontWeight":"normal","stroke":"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)","strokeWidth":1,"opacity":1,"editable":false,"version":"V2","offsetY":0.04,"h":50.22,"rotate":0,"textType":"text","lineHeight":1,"z-index":0,"font":"NotoSans","fontsize":48,"weight":"","id":"3b029596-65c3-442e-aa66-cdac3712ad96","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"For hardware functions such as input and output and memory allocation, the operating system acts as an intermediary between programs and the computer hardware,although the application code is usually executed directly by the hardware and frequently makes system calls to an OS function or is interrupted by it. Operating systems are found on many devices that contain a computer – from cellular phones and video game consoles to web servers and supercomputers.\",\"color\":\"#000000\",\"fontfamily\":\"NotoSans\",\"fontsize\":18,\"fontweight\":false,\"fontstyle\":false,\"align\":\"left\"}"}}]},{"x":0,"y":0,"w":100,"h":100,"id":"0caacc74-072d-4e93-87d1-7b4516571796","rotate":null,"config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"color\":\"#FFFFFF\",\"instructions\":\"\",\"genieControls\":false}"},"param":[{"name":"previous","value":"bd85bbc6-7922-47d1-a667-06016ac8b1d5"},{"name":"next","value":"48aeadb7-ce53-41e7-8026-cbd66e0b54ce"}],"manifest":{"media":[]},"org.ekstep.richtext":[{"type":"rect","x":5.42,"y":7.16,"fill":"rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)","opacity":1,"w":66.91,"h":11.77,"rotate":0,"z-index":0,"fontSize":37.33,"id":"68152bc3-5440-48db-b6e7-7ead042336cd","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"

SINGLE AND MULTITASKING

\\n\"}"}}],"org.ekstep.text":[{"x":5.42,"y":23.46,"minWidth":20,"w":79.55,"maxWidth":500,"fill":"#000000","fontStyle":"normal","fontWeight":"normal","stroke":"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)","strokeWidth":1,"opacity":1,"editable":false,"version":"V2","offsetY":0.04,"h":65.29,"rotate":0,"textType":"text","lineHeight":1,"z-index":1,"font":"NotoSans","fontsize":48,"weight":"","id":"23511cc4-81a1-4983-835b-ce986e508889","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"A single-tasking system can only run one program at a time, while a multi-tasking operating system allows more than one program to be running in concurrency. This is achieved by time-sharing, where the available processor time is divided between multiple processes. These processes are each interrupted repeatedly in time slices by a task-scheduling subsystem of the operating system. Multi-tasking may be characterized in preemptive and co-operative types. In preemptive multitasking, the operating system slices the CPU time and dedicates a slot to each of the programs. Unix-like operating systems, such as Solaris and Linux—as well as non-Unix-like, such as AmigaOS—support preemptive multitasking. Cooperative multitasking is achieved by relying on each process to provide time to the other processes in a defined manner. \",\"color\":\"#000000\",\"fontfamily\":\"NotoSans\",\"fontsize\":18,\"fontweight\":false,\"fontstyle\":false,\"align\":\"left\"}"}}]},{"x":0,"y":0,"w":100,"h":100,"id":"48aeadb7-ce53-41e7-8026-cbd66e0b54ce","rotate":null,"config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"color\":\"#FFFFFF\",\"instructions\":\"\",\"genieControls\":false}"},"param":[{"name":"previous","value":"0caacc74-072d-4e93-87d1-7b4516571796"},{"name":"next","value":"5822b334-8dcc-48db-bb73-429c2cdb5b0b"}],"manifest":{"media":[]},"org.ekstep.richtext":[{"type":"rect","x":12.36,"y":16.05,"fill":"rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)","opacity":1,"w":41.08,"h":13.09,"rotate":0,"z-index":0,"fontSize":37.33,"id":"68a2679e-4130-4640-965e-5b806e892a2a","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"

Single- and multi-user

\\n\",\"fontfamily\":\"NotoSans\",\"fontsize\":\"14px\"}"}}],"org.ekstep.text":[{"x":12.36,"y":31.6,"minWidth":20,"w":74.33,"maxWidth":500,"fill":"#000000","fontStyle":"normal","fontWeight":"normal","stroke":"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)","strokeWidth":1,"opacity":1,"editable":false,"version":"V2","offsetY":0.04,"h":50.22,"rotate":0,"textType":"text","lineHeight":1,"z-index":1,"font":"NotoSans","fontsize":48,"weight":"","id":"34913aee-bae5-4761-9bca-6ab740954d37","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"Single-user operating systems have no facilities to distinguish users, but may allow multiple programs to run in tandem.[6] A multi-user operating system extends the basic concept of multi-tasking with facilities that identify processes and resources, such as disk space, belonging to multiple users, and the system permits multiple users to interact with the system at the same time. Time-sharing operating systems schedule tasks for efficient use of the system and may also include accounting software for cost allocation of processor time, mass storage, printing, and other resources to multiple users.\",\"color\":\"#000000\",\"fontfamily\":\"NotoSans\",\"fontsize\":18,\"fontweight\":false,\"fontstyle\":false,\"align\":\"left\"}"}}]},{"x":0,"y":0,"w":100,"h":100,"id":"5822b334-8dcc-48db-bb73-429c2cdb5b0b","rotate":null,"config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"color\":\"#FFFFFF\",\"instructions\":\"\",\"genieControls\":false}"},"param":[{"name":"previous","value":"48aeadb7-ce53-41e7-8026-cbd66e0b54ce"},{"name":"next","value":"43cccd6e-c82e-4565-954c-690b22b9301e"}],"manifest":{"media":[]},"org.ekstep.text":[{"x":12.78,"y":19.51,"minWidth":20,"w":35,"maxWidth":500,"fill":"#000000","fontStyle":"normal","fontWeight":"normal","stroke":"rgba(255, Distributed

\\n\"}"}}],"org.ekstep.text":[{"x":10.28,"y":17.78,"minWidth":20,"w":78.44,"maxWidth":500,"fill":"#000000","fontStyle":"normal","fontWeight":"normal","stroke":"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)","strokeWidth":1,"opacity":1,"editable":false,"version":"V2","offsetY":0.04,"h":35.16,"rotate":0,"textType":"text","lineHeight":1,"z-index":1,"font":"NotoSans","fontsize":48,"weight":"","id":"1a28d3e0-1e07-4da3-a3a4-64384b96a83c","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"A distributed operating system manages a group of distinct computers and makes them appear to be a single computer. The development of networked computers that could be linked and communicate with each other gave rise to distributed computing. Distributed computations are carried out on more than one machine. When computers in a group work in cooperation, they form a distributed system\",\"color\":\"#000000\",\"fontfamily\":\"NotoSans\",\"fontsize\":18,\"fontweight\":false,\"fontstyle\":false,\"align\":\"left\"}"}}]},{"x":0,"y":0,"w":100,"h":100,"id":"dd24ecc0-1db3-4ea1-b4cd-c91d65710dc6","rotate":null,"config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"color\":\"#FFFFFF\",\"instructions\":\"\",\"genieControls\":false}"},"param":[{"name":"previous","value":"43cccd6e-c82e-4565-954c-690b22b9301e"},{"name":"next","value":"2c809647-8363-4960-9799-0d5489a80b47"}],"manifest":{"media":[]},"org.ekstep.text":[{"x":10,"y":20,"minWidth":20,"w":56.63,"maxWidth":500,"fill":"#000000","fontStyle":"normal","fontWeight":"normal","stroke":"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)","strokeWidth":1,"opacity":1,"editable":false,"version":"V2","offsetY":0.04,"h":40.18,"rotate":0,"textType":"text","lineHeight":1,"z-index":0,"font":"NotoSans","fontsize":48,"weight":"","id":"83a08637-bbe9-428a-9191-d3560d1e61e8","config":{"__cdata":"{\"opacity\":100,\"strokeWidth\":1,\"stroke\":\"rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)\",\"autoplay\":false,\"visible\":true,\"text\":\"In an OS, distributed and cloud computing context, templating refers to creating a single virtual machine image as a guest operating system, then saving it as a tool for multiple running virtual machines. The technique is used both in virtualization and cloud computing management, and is common in large server
